mpmToolbox.gui.syncPlayer

Class SyncPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.alee.managers.language.LanguageEventMethods, com.alee.managers.language.LanguageMethods, com.alee.managers.settings.SettingsMethods, com.alee.managers.style.Styleable, com.alee.managers.tooltip.ToolTipMethods, com.alee.utils.swing.extensions.ContainerMethods<com.alee.laf.panel.WebPanel>, com.alee.utils.swing.extensions.EventMethods, com.alee.utils.swing.extensions.FontMethods<com.alee.laf.panel.WebPanel>, com.alee.utils.swing.extensions.MethodExtension, com.alee.utils.swing.extensions.SizeMethods<com.alee.laf.panel.WebPanel>, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class SyncPlayer
extends com.alee.laf.panel.WebPanel
    This class implements the Audio and MIDI player for MPM Toolbox. It is able to play both media in parallel.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public void updatePerformanceList()

      • updateMidiPortList

        public void updateMidiPortList()
        This fills the MIDI port chooser list. The method should be called to initialize and update the list. See: https://humanwritescode.wordpress.com/2017/11/22/java-midi-basics-how-to-access-a-midi-device-or-midi-port-in-java/

      • updateAudioList

        public void updateAudioList()
        This fills the audio chooser list. It should be called when the list of audio recordings changes.

      • triggerPlayback

        public void triggerPlayback(long samplePosition)
        start/stop playback; works only if an audio file is selected for playback because its sample rate is required to relate the sample position to a relative playtime position
        Parameters:
        samplePosition - the sample position to start playback
